translated: Volume 19 of the Comprehensive Chronicle of Buddhas and Patriarchs
Compiled by Zhipan, a monk from Donghu in Siming during the Jingding era of the Song Dynasty
Biographies of Various Masters, Part 6, Chapter 9

Disciples of Dharma Master Huayan Wu: Dharma Master Xiaoyan Wenhu, Dharma Master Guangzhi (8th Generation), Dharma Master Xilin Zhen, Dharma Master Faming Shichang, Dharma Master Yitang Gui, Dharma Master Tong'an Yunxian, Dharma Master Shitpo Yuanqi, Dharma Master Zhupu Ruyue, Dharma Master Shiwu Zhengji, Dharma Master Ke Tang Ruocan, Dharma Master Huaweng Shizan, Dharma Master Jizong Shiyue, Dharma Master Bu Gu Youlin, Dharma Master Baiting Yue, Dharma Master Xianglin Qingci, Dharma Master Yitang Liaoyuan, Dharma Master Shittian Miaohui, Dharma Master Banyun Xingru, Dharma Master Cishi Dafang, Dharma Master Xuzhong Yuanzhen, Dharma Master Dunshan Shiyao, Dharma Master Guyan Ruqi, Dharma Master Ji'an Wenhui, Dharma Master Huayan Wenjie, Dharma Master Xunzhong Daoqian

This volume has 32 people. The original text of the main record is missing.Here is the corrected and aligned text: The Complete Chronicle of the Buddha and Patriarchs, Volume 19
End. Dharma Master Bai Ting Yue's Dharma Heirs Dharma Master Bai Ting Yue's Dharma Heirs Dharma Master Wen Jie.
The name Tong Sou.
He called himself Cao An.
He was the son of the Xia family in Cixi, Siming.
The family was a large clan with over a hundred households.
Those who traveled often heard the sound of reading.
His father, surnamed Li, was a virtuous and kind man. At that time, there was a lecturer named Zhu Shan Ding who exempted his ancestors.
He encouraged him to leave home and live at Yongming Temple in the town.
The next year, he shaved his head.
At seventeen, he traveled to various places, and later lived at Yue'an, which were the most prestigious mountain temples. The master and Tian both studied with Zhizong, but had not attained anything.
He met Xishan Ci Jiao Baiting Yue Dharma Master.
He used a great furnace to refine and train students.
The master then raised the banner of diligence and stayed for thirteen years.
He followed to Shangzhu.
There were three masters, Qian, Hui, and Ying, who all had great reputations.
The master joined them as the four outstanding talents.
Baiting said to the master,
Your country, your country has obtained the entirety of me.
After all, what is the ultimate phrase?
The master shouted loudly,
Blinding the eye on the forehead, there is spring in the cauldron.
At this point, there is no form to be seen in heaven or on earth, and no color to be enjoyed.
Baiting resigned from his position for ninety days and the assembly dispersed.
The master stayed alone for three summers.
Only when the Buddha's extinction was announced did he retire.
At the age of fifty-one.
He first came out in the world at Guanyin Temple in Dinghai.
For fourteen years he lived at Yuquan Temple in Xiangshan.
For six years he ascended to Jietan Temple in Tianzhu.
It was founded by Emperor Lizong at Jiumaosong.
He continued the will and followed the previous teachings. The abbot Benfa.
The master asked to leave the nine layers of the palace alone and decided to replace him with Cao'an.
The myriad people were shocked and submitted.
In ten years, the lecture bell and Dharma drum shook the mountains by the lake.
Students from all directions came like water flowing downwards.
Establishing rules and norms, with propriety and order.
Guizong Temple in Nanhu, Siming.
In the Wan Mountains, it is said to be a good place in East Wu.
The crowd strongly urged the master to take charge of it.
On the twenty-sixth day of the second month in the renwu year of the Zhizheng era, he beat the drum to inform the assembly, wrote a verse on the coffin, threw down the brush and passed away.
He lived to the age of eighty-six and was a monk for seventy-three years.
His writings include the Essential Collection of the Summit of the Teachings and the Collection of the Summit of the Teachings.
He wrote to his disciple Juechu Yi, telling him to return to his home mountain Shanqing Hermitage, where his whole body was buried.

Those who attained the Dharma were like Si Lanzi Hua, Sizhi, Yijian Mingzhi, Dayu Dong, Huhai Fawang, Fawang Dong, and others. He wrote the Golden Scalpel with a half-moon of free time and the Book of Dream Interpretation.
He also wrote the Verses on Contemplating the Mind and Contemplating the Buddha, which say:
When spring arrives, the upper garden is all like brocade. There is no need to search for the old man who sells flowers.
Jing Shan Yu Chan Master sighed with admiration.
